topic_0003.definition: A category denoting a rather broad domain or field of interest, of study, application, work, data, or technology. Topics have no clearly defined borders between each other.
topic_0003.name: Topic

topic_0605.definition: The study and practice of information processing and use of computer information systems.
topic_0605.name: Informatics

topic_0089.definition: The conceptualisation, categorisation and nomenclature (naming) of entities or phenomena within biology or bioinformatics. This includes formal ontologies, controlled vocabularies, structured glossary, symbols and terminology or other related resource.
topic_0089.name: Ontology and terminology

topic_0091.definition: The archival, curation, processing and analysis of complex biological data.
topic_0091.name: Bioinformatics

topic_0607.definition: Laboratory management and resources, for example, catalogues of biological resources for use in the lab including cell lines, viruses, plasmids, phages, DNA probes and primers and so on.
topic_0607.name: Laboratory information management

topic_2258.definition: The application of information technology to chemistry in biological research environment.
topic_2258.name: Cheminformatics

topic_3063.definition: The application of information technology to health, disease and biomedicine.
topic_3063.name: Medical informatics

topic_3071.definition: The development and use of architectures, policies, practices and procedures for management of data.
topic_3071.name: Biological databases

topic_0219.definition: Deposition and curation of database accessions, including annotation, typically with terms from a controlled vocabulary.

path.name: Topic||Informatics||Biological databases||Data submission, annotation and curation

topic_0219.name: Data submission, annotation and curation

topic_0769.definition: Biological or biomedical analytical workflows or pipelines.
topic_0769.name: Workflows

topic_3077.definition: The acquisition of data, typically measurements of physical systems using any type of sampling system, or by another other means.
topic_3077.name: Data acquisition

topic_3263.definition: The protection of data, such as patient health data, from damage or unwanted access from unauthorised users.
topic_3263.name: Data security

topic_3345.definition: Topic concerning the identity of biological entities, or reports on such entities, and the mapping of entities and records in different databases.
topic_3345.name: Data identity and mapping

topic_3365.definition: The development of policies, models and standards that cover data acquisition, storage and integration, such that it can be put to use, typically through a process of systematically applying statistical and / or logical techniques to describe, illustrate, summarise or evaluate data.

path.name: Topic||Informatics||Biological databases||Data architecture, analysis and design

topic_3365.name: Data architecture, analysis and design

topic_3366.definition: The combination and integration of data from different sources, for example into a central repository or warehouse, to provide users with a unified view of these data.
topic_3366.name: Data integration and warehousing

topic_3489.definition: The general handling of data stored in digital archives such as databanks, databases proper, web portals and other data resources.
topic_3489.name: Database management

topic_3571.definition: The control of data entry and maintenance to ensure the data meets defined standards, qualities or constraints.
topic_3571.name: Data governance

topic_3572.definition: The quality, integrity, and cleaning up of data.
topic_3572.name: Data quality management

topic_3948.definition: Immunoinformatics is the field of computational biology that deals with the study of immunoloogical questions. Immunoinformatics is at the interface between immunology and computer science. It takes advantage of computational, statistical, mathematical approaches and enhances the understanding of immunological knowledge.
topic_3948.name: Immunoinformatics

topic_3068.definition: The scientific literature, language processing, reference information, and documentation.
topic_3068.name: Literature and language

topic_0218.definition: The processing and analysis of natural language, such as scientific literature in English, in order to extract data and information, or to enable human-computer interaction.
topic_0218.name: Natural language processing

topic_3070.definition: The study of life and living organisms, including their morphology, biochemistry, physiology, development, evolution, and so on.
topic_3070.name: Biology

topic_0610.definition: The ecological and environmental sciences and especially the application of information technology (ecoinformatics).
topic_0610.name: Ecology

topic_3050.definition: The degree of variation of life forms within a given ecosystem, biome or an entire planet.
topic_3050.name: Biodiversity

topic_3174.definition: The study of genetic material recovered from environmental samples, and associated environmental data.
topic_3174.name: Metagenomics

topic_3697.definition: The ecology of microorganisms including their relationship with one another and their environment.
topic_3697.name: Microbial ecology

topic_0621.definition: A specific organism, or group of organisms, used to study a particular aspect of biology.
topic_0621.name: Model organisms

topic_0780.definition: Plants, e.g. information on a specific plant genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.
topic_0780.name: Plant biology

topic_0781.definition: Study of viruses, e.g. sequence and structural data, interactions of viral proteins, or a viral genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.
topic_0781.name: Virology

topic_1317.definition: The molecular structure of biological molecules, particularly macromolecules such as proteins and nucleic acids.
topic_1317.name: Structural biology

topic_0122.definition: The elucidation of the three dimensional structure for all (available) proteins in a given organism.
topic_0122.name: Structural genomics

topic_0593.definition: An analytical technique that exploits the magenetic properties of certain atomic nuclei to provide information on the structure, dynamics, reaction state and chemical environment of molecules.
topic_0593.name: NMR
narrow_synonyms: Rotational Frame Nuclear Overhauser Effect Spectroscopy

topic_0611.definition: The study of matter by studying the interference pattern from firing electrons at a sample, to analyse structures at resolutions higher than can be achieved using light.
topic_0611.name: Electron microscopy

topic_2828.definition: The study of matter and their structure by means of the diffraction of X-rays, typically the diffraction pattern caused by the regularly spaced atoms of a crystalline sample.
topic_2828.name: X-ray diffraction

topic_3448.definition: The study of matter by studying the diffraction pattern from firing neutrons at a sample, typically to determine atomic and/or magnetic structure.
topic_3448.name: Neutron diffraction

topic_2229.definition: Cells, such as key genes and proteins involved in the cell cycle.
topic_2229.name: Cell biology

topic_2259.definition: The holistic modelling and analysis of complex biological systems and the interactions therein.
topic_2259.name: Systems biology

topic_2815.definition: The study of human beings in general, including the human genome and proteome.
topic_2815.name: Human biology

topic_3047.definition: The molecular basis of biological activity, particularly the macromolecules (e.g. proteins and nucleic acids) that are essential to life.
topic_3047.name: Molecular biology

topic_3053.definition: The study of genes, genetic variation and heredity in living organisms.
topic_3053.name: Genetics

topic_0625.definition: The study of genetic constitution of a living entity, such as an individual, and organism, a cell and so on, typically with respect to a particular observable phenotypic traits, or resources concerning such traits, which might be an aspect of biochemistry, physiology, morphology, anatomy, development and so on.
topic_0625.name: Genotype and phenotype

topic_3055.definition: The genes and genetic mechanisms such as Mendelian inheritance that underly continuous phenotypic traits (such as height or weight).
topic_3055.name: Quantitative genetics

topic_3298.definition: Phenomes, or the study of the change in phenotype (the physical and biochemical traits of organisms) in response to genetic and environmental factors.
topic_3298.name: Phenomics

topic_3945.definition: The study of the process and mechanism of change of biomolecules such as DNA, RNA, and proteins across generations.
topic_3945.name: Molecular evolution

topic_3056.definition: The distribution of allele frequencies in a population of organisms and its change subject to evolutionary processes including natural selection, genetic drift, mutation and gene flow.
topic_3056.name: Population genetics

topic_3295.definition: Topic concerning the study of heritable changes, for example in gene expression or phenotype, caused by mechanisms other than changes in the DNA sequence.
topic_3295.name: Epigenetics

topic_3173.definition: The study of the epigenetic modifications of a whole cell, tissue, organism etc.
topic_3173.name: Epigenomics

topic_3974.definition: The study of the epigenetic modifications of a whole cell, tissue, organism etc.
topic_3974.name: Epistasis

topic_3321.definition: The structure and function of genes at a molecular level.
topic_3321.name: Molecular genetics

topic_0114.definition: Gene structure, regions which make an RNA product and features such as promoters, coding regions, gene fusion, splice sites etc.
topic_0114.name: Gene structure

topic_0659.definition: Non-coding or functional RNA sequences, including regulatory RNA sequences, ribosomal RNA (rRNA) and transfer RNA (tRNA).

path.name: Topic||Biology||Genetics||Molecular genetics||Gene structure||Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA
Topic||Computational biology||Nucleic acids||RNA||Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA
Topic||Computational biology||Molecular genetics||Gene structure||Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA

topic_0659.name: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA

topic_0798.definition: Mobile genetic elements, such as transposons, Plasmids, Bacteriophage elements and Group II introns.

path.name: Topic||Computational biology||Molecular genetics||Gene structure||Mobile genetic elements

topic_0798.name: Mobile genetic elements

topic_3512.definition: Transcription of DNA into RNA and features of a messenger RNA (mRNA) molecules including precursor RNA, primary (unprocessed) transcript and fully processed molecules.
topic_3512.name: Gene transcripts

topic_0199.definition: Stable, naturally occuring mutations in a nucleotide sequence including alleles, naturally occurring mutations such as single base nucleotide substitutions, deletions and insertions, RFLPs and other polymorphisms.
topic_0199.name: Genetic variation

topic_2885.name: DNA polymorphism
narrow_synonyms: Variable number of tandem repeat polymorphism

topic_3175.definition: Variation in chromosome structure including microscopic and submicroscopic types of variation such as deletions, duplications, copy-number variants, insertions, inversions and translocations.
topic_3175.name: Structural variation

topic_3958.definition: A DNA structural variation, specifically a duplication or deletion event, resulting in sections of the genome to be repeated, or the number of repeats in the genome to vary between individuals.

path.name: Topic||Biology||Genetics||Molecular genetics||Genetic variation||Structural variation||Copy number variation
Topic||Computational biology||Nucleic acids||DNA||Structural variation||Copy number variation
Topic||Computational biology||Molecular genetics||Genetic variation||Structural variation||Copy number variation

topic_3958.name: Copy number variation

topic_0203.definition: The analysis of levels and patterns of synthesis of gene products (proteins and functional RNA) including interpretation in functional terms of gene expression data.
topic_0203.name: Gene expression

topic_0749.definition: Proteins that bind to DNA and control transcription of DNA to mRNA (transcription factors) and also transcriptional regulatory sites, elements and regions (such as promoters, enhancers, silencers and boundary elements / insulators) in nucleotide sequences.

path.name: Topic||Biology||Genetics||Molecular genetics||Gene expression||Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Topic||Computational biology||Nucleic acids||DNA||DNA binding sites||Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Topic||Computational biology||Nucleic acids||Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs||DNA binding sites||Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Topic||Computational biology||Proteins||Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Topic||Computational biology||Sequence sites, features and motifs||Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs||DNA binding sites||Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Topic||Computational biology||Molecular genetics||Gene expression||Transcription factors and regulatory sites

topic_0749.name: Transcription factors and regulatory sites

topic_3308.definition: The analysis of transcriptomes, or a set of all the RNA molecules in a specific cell, tissue etc.
topic_3308.name: Transcriptomics

topic_3941.definition: The study of microbe gene expression within natural environments (i.e. the metatranscriptome).
topic_3941.name: Metatranscriptomics

topic_3320.definition: RNA splicing; post-transcription RNA modification involving the removal of introns and joining of exons.
topic_3320.name: RNA splicing

topic_0623.definition: Particular gene(s), gene family or other gene group or system and their encoded proteins.Primarily the classification of proteins (from sequence or structural data) into clusters, groups, families etc., curation of a particular protein or protein family, or any other proteins that have been classified as members of a common group.

path.name: Topic||Computational biology||Molecular genetics||Gene and protein families

topic_0623.name: Gene and protein families

path.name: Topic||Biology||Genetics||Molecular genetics||Gene and protein families||Immunoproteins and antigens
Topic||Computational biology||Proteins||Gene and protein families||Immunoproteins and antigens
Topic||Computational biology||Molecular genetics||Gene and protein families||Immunoproteins and antigens

topic_3959.definition: The branch of genetics concerned with the relationships between chromosomes and cellular behaviour, especially during mitosis and meiosis.
topic_3959.name: Cytogenetics

topic_3574.definition: The study of inheritance in human beings.
topic_3574.name: Human genetics

topic_3912.definition: The application of biotechnology to directly manipulate an organism's genes.
topic_3912.name: Genetic engineering

topic_3930.definition: A biomedical field that bridges immunology and genetics, to study the genetic basis of the immune system.
topic_3930.name: Immunogenetics

topic_3065.definition: The development of organisms between the one-cell stage (typically the zygote) and the end of the embryonic stage.
topic_3065.name: Embryology

topic_3292.definition: Chemical substances and physico-chemical processes and that occur within living organisms.
topic_3292.name: Biochemistry

topic_3297.definition: The exploitation of biological process, structure and function for industrial purposes, for example the genetic manipulation of microorganisms for the antibody production.
topic_3297.name: Biotechnology

topic_3368.definition: Any matter, surface or construct that interacts with a biological system.
topic_3368.name: Biomaterials

topic_3398.definition: The application of biological concepts and methods to the analytical and synthetic methodologies of engineering.
topic_3398.name: Bioengineering

topic_3576.definition: Biotechnology applied to the medical sciences and the development of medicines.
topic_3576.name: Medical biotechnology

topic_3895.definition: The application of multi-disciplinary science and technology for the construction of artificial biological systems for diverse applications.
topic_3895.name: Synthetic biology

topic_3299.definition: The evolutionary processes, from the genetic to environmental scale, that produced life in all its diversity.
topic_3299.name: Evolutionary biology

topic_0084.definition: The study of evolutionary relationships amongst organisms.
topic_0084.name: Phylogeny

topic_3293.definition: The study of evolutionary relationships amongst organisms from analysis of genetic information (typically gene or protein sequences).
topic_3293.name: Phylogenetics

topic_3944.definition: The biological classification of organisms by categorizing them in groups ("clades") based on their most recent common ancestor.
topic_3944.name: Cladistics

topic_3306.definition: The use of physics to study biological system.
topic_3306.name: Biophysics

topic_3360.definition: Objective indicators of biological state often used to assess health, and determinate treatment.
topic_3360.name: Biomarkers

topic_3369.definition: The use of synthetic chemistry to study and manipulate biological systems.
topic_3369.name: Chemical biology

topic_3387.definition: The study of organisms in the ocean or brackish waters.
topic_3387.name: Marine biology

topic_3500.definition: Animals, e.g. information on a specific animal genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.
topic_3500.name: Zoology

topic_3573.definition: The study of organisms in freshwater ecosystems.
topic_3573.name: Freshwater biology

topic_3810.definition: Multidisciplinary study, research and development within the field of agriculture.
topic_3810.name: Agricultural science

topic_3855.definition: Study of the environment, the interactions between its physical, chemical, and biological components and it's effect on life.  Also how humans impact upon the environment, and how we can manage and utilise natural resources.
topic_3855.name: Environmental science

topic_3303.definition: Research in support of healing by diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of disease.
topic_3303.name: Medicine

topic_0634.definition: Diseases, including diseases in general and the genes, gene variations and proteins involved in one or more specific diseases.
topic_0634.name: Pathology

topic_3324.definition: The branch of medicine that deals with the prevention, diagnosis and management of transmissable disease with clinically evident illness resulting from infection with pathogenic biological agents (viruses, bacteria, fungi, protozoa, parasites and prions).
topic_3324.name: Infectious disease

topic_2640.definition: The study of cancer, for example, genes and proteins implicated in cancer.
topic_2640.name: Oncology

topic_2840.definition: Toxins and the adverse effects of these chemical substances on living organisms.

path.name: Topic||Biomedical science||Medicines research and development||Safety sciences||Toxicology

topic_2840.name: Toxicology

topic_3300.definition: The functions of living organisms and their constituent parts.
topic_3300.name: Physiology

topic_3305.definition: Topic concerning the the patterns, cause, and effect of disease within populations.
topic_3305.name: Public health and epidemiology

topic_3334.definition: The branch of medicine that deals with the anatomy, functions and disorders of the nervous system.
topic_3334.name: Neurology

topic_3335.definition: The diseases and abnormalities of the heart and circulatory system.
topic_3335.name: Cardiology

topic_3342.definition: 'translating' the output of basic and biomedical research into better diagnostic tools, medicines, medical procedures, policies and advice.
topic_3342.name: Translational medicine

topic_3388.definition: The identification of molecular and genetic causes of disease and the development of interventions to correct them.
topic_3388.name: Molecular medicine

topic_3396.definition: An interdisciplinary field of study that looks at the dynamic systems of the human body as part of an integrted whole, incoporating biochemical, physiological, and environmental interactions that sustain life.
topic_3396.name: Systems medicine

topic_3397.definition: Topic concerning the branch of medicine that deals with the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of disease, disorder and injury in animals.
topic_3397.name: Veterinary medicine

topic_3399.definition: The branch of medicine dealing with the diagnosis, treatment and prevention of disease in older people, and the problems specific to aging.
topic_3399.name: Geriatric medicine

topic_3400.definition: Health issues related to the immune system and their prevention, diagnosis and mangement.
topic_3400.name: Allergy, clinical immunology and immunotherapeutics

topic_3401.definition: The prevention of pain and the evaluation, treatment and rehabilitation of persons in pain.
topic_3401.name: Pain medicine

topic_3403.definition: The multidisciplinary that cares for patients with acute, life-threatening illness or injury.
topic_3403.name: Critical care medicine

topic_3404.definition: The branch of medicine that deals with prevention, diagnosis and treatment of disorders of the skin, scalp, hair and nails.
topic_3404.name: Dermatology

topic_3405.definition: The study, diagnosis, prevention and treatments of disorders of the oral cavity, maxillofacial area and adjacent structures.
topic_3405.name: Dentistry

topic_3406.definition: The branch of medicine that deals with the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of disorders of the ear, nose and throat.
topic_3406.name: Ear, nose and throat medicine

topic_3407.definition: The branch of medicine dealing with diseases of endocrine organs, hormone systems, their target organs, and disorders of the pathways of glucose and lipid metabolism.
topic_3407.name: Endocrinology and metabolism

topic_3408.definition: The branch of medicine that deals with the blood, blood-forming organs and blood diseases.
topic_3408.name: Haematology

topic_3409.definition: The branch of medicine that deals with disorders of the oesophagus, stomach, duodenum, jejenum, ileum, large intestine, sigmoid colon and rectum.
topic_3409.name: Gastroenterology

topic_3410.definition: The study of the biological and physiological differences between males and females and how they effect differences in disease presentation and management.
topic_3410.name: Gender medicine

topic_3411.definition: The branch of medicine that deals with the health of the female reproductive system, pregnancy and birth.
topic_3411.name: Gynaecology and obstetrics

topic_3412.definition: The branch of medicine that deals with the liver, gallbladder, bile ducts and bile.
topic_3412.name: Hepatic and biliary medicine

topic_3414.definition: The branch of medicine that treats body wounds or shock produced by sudden physical injury, as from violence or accident.
topic_3414.name: Trauma medicine

topic_3415.definition: The branch of medicine that deals with the diagnosis, management and prevention of poisoning and other adverse health effects caused by medications, occupational and environmental toxins, and biological agents.
topic_3415.name: Medical toxicology

topic_3416.definition: The branch of medicine that deals with the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of disorders of the muscle, bone and connective tissue.  It incorporates aspects of orthopaedics, rheumatology, rehabilitation medicine and pain medicine.
topic_3416.name: Musculoskeletal medicine

topic_3417.definition: The branch of medicine that deals with disorders of the eye, including eyelid, optic nerve/visual pathways and occular muscles.
topic_3417.name: Opthalmology

topic_3418.definition: The branch of medicine that deals with the medical care of infants, children and adolescents.
topic_3418.name: Paediatrics

topic_3419.definition: The branch of medicine that deals with the mangement of mental illness, emotional disturbance and abnormal behaviour.
topic_3419.name: Psychiatry

topic_3420.definition: The health of the reproductive processes, functions and systems at all stages of life.
topic_3420.name: Reproductive health

topic_3421.definition: The use of operative, manual and instrumental techniques on a patient to investigate and/or treat a pathological condition or help improve bodily function or appearance.
topic_3421.name: Surgery

topic_3422.definition: The branches of medicine and physiology focussing on the function and disorders of the urinary system in males and females, the reproductive system in males, and the kidney.
topic_3422.name: Urology and nephrology

topic_3423.definition: Medical therapies that fall beyond the scope of conventional medicine but may be used alongside it in the treatment of disease and ill health.
topic_3423.name: Complementary medicine

topic_3575.definition: Health problems that are prevalent in tropical and subtropical regions.
topic_3575.name: Tropical medicine

topic_3577.definition: An approach to medicine whereby decisions, practices and are tailored to the individual patient based on their predicted response or risk of disease.
topic_3577.name: Personalised medicine

topic_3307.definition: The development and application of theory, analytical methods, mathematical models and computational simulation of biological systems.
topic_3307.name: Computational biology

topic_0077.definition: The processing and analysis of nucleic acid sequence, structural and other data.
topic_0077.name: Nucleic acids

children.name: Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs

topic_0097.definition: The archival, curation, processing and analysis of nucleic acid structural information, such as whole structures, structural features and alignments, and associated annotation.

path.name: Topic||Computational biology||Nucleic acids||Nucleic acid structure analysis
Topic||Computational biology||Structure analysis||Nucleic acid structure analysis

topic_0097.name: Nucleic acid structure analysis

topic_0654.definition: DNA sequences and structure, including processes such as methylation and replication.
topic_0654.name: DNA

topic_3125.definition: Nucleic acids binding to some other molecule.

path.name: Topic||Computational biology||Nucleic acids||Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs||DNA binding sites
Topic||Computational biology||Sequence sites, features and motifs||Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs||DNA binding sites

topic_3125.name: DNA binding sites

path.name: Topic||Computational biology||Nucleic acids||DNA||DNA replication and recombination

topic_3176.definition: DNA-histone complexes (chromatin), organisation of chromatin into nucleosomes and packaging into higher-order structures.
topic_3176.name: DNA packaging

topic_3511.definition: The biology, archival, detection, prediction and analysis of positional features such as functional and other key sites, in nucleic acid sequences and the conserved patterns (motifs, profiles etc.) that may be used to describe them.

path.name: Topic||Computational biology||Nucleic acids||Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs
Topic||Computational biology||Sequence sites, features and motifs||Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs

topic_3511.name: Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs

topic_0078.definition: Archival, processing and analysis of protein data, typically molecular sequence and structural data.
topic_0078.name: Proteins

topic_0108.definition: The translation of mRNA into protein and subsequent protein processing in the cell.
topic_0108.name: Protein expression

topic_0140.definition: The study of how proteins are transported within and without the cell, including signal peptides, protein subcellular localisation and export.

path.name: Topic||Computational biology||Proteins||Protein expression||Protein targeting and localisation

topic_0140.name: Protein targeting and localisation

topic_0601.definition: Protein chemical modifications, e.g. post-translational modifications.
topic_0601.name: Protein modifications

topic_3120.definition: Protein sequence variants produced e.g. from alternative splicing, alternative promoter usage, alternative initiation and ribosomal frameshifting.
topic_3120.name: Protein variants

topic_0123.definition: The study of the physical and biochemical properties of peptides and proteins, for example the hydrophobic, hydrophilic and charge properties of a protein.
topic_0123.name: Protein properties

topic_0128.definition: Protein-protein, protein-DNA/RNA and protein-ligand interactions, including analysis of known interactions and prediction of putative interactions.

path.name: Topic||Computational biology||Molecular interactions, pathways and networks||Protein interactions

topic_0128.name: Protein interactions

topic_0820.definition: Lipoproteins (protein-lipid assemblies), and proteins or region of a protein that spans or are associated with a membrane.
topic_0820.name: Membrane and lipoproteins

topic_0821.definition: Proteins that catalyze chemical reaction, the kinetics of enzyme-catalysed reactions, enzyme nomenclature etc.
topic_0821.name: Enzymes

topic_2814.definition: Protein secondary or tertiary structural data and/or associated annotation.
topic_2814.name: Protein structure analysis

topic_0130.definition: Protein stability, folding (in 3D space) and protein sequence-structure-function relationships.  This includes for example study of inter-atomic or inter-residue interactions in protein (3D) structures, the effect of mutation, and the design of proteins with specific properties, typically by designing changes (via site-directed mutagenesis) to an existing protein.

path.name: Topic||Computational biology||Proteins||Protein structure analysis||Protein folding, stability and design
Topic||Computational biology||Structure analysis||Protein structure analysis||Protein folding, stability and design

topic_0130.name: Protein folding, stability and design

topic_0166.definition: Structural features or common 3D motifs within protein structures, including the surface of a protein structure, such as biological interfaces with other molecules.

path.name: Topic||Computational biology||Proteins||Protein structure analysis||Protein structural motifs and surfaces
Topic||Computational biology||Structure analysis||Protein structure analysis||Protein structural motifs and surfaces

topic_0166.name: Protein structural motifs and surfaces

topic_0736.definition: Protein tertiary structural domains and folds in a protein or polypeptide chain.

path.name: Topic||Computational biology||Proteins||Protein structure analysis||Protein folds and structural domains
Topic||Computational biology||Structure analysis||Protein structure analysis||Protein folds and structural domains

topic_0736.name: Protein folds and structural domains

path.name: Topic||Computational biology||Proteins||Protein structure analysis||Protein disordered structure
Topic||Computational biology||Structure analysis||Protein structure analysis||Protein disordered structure

topic_3542.definition: Secondary structure (predicted or real) of a protein, including super-secondary structure.

path.name: Topic||Computational biology||Proteins||Protein structure analysis||Protein secondary structure
Topic||Computational biology||Structure analysis||Protein structure analysis||Protein secondary structure

topic_3542.name: Protein secondary structure

topic_3510.definition: The biology, archival, detection, prediction and analysis of positional features such as functional and other key sites, in protein sequences and the conserved patterns (motifs, profiles etc.) that may be used to describe them.

path.name: Topic||Computational biology||Proteins||Protein sites, features and motifs
Topic||Computational biology||Sequence sites, features and motifs||Protein sites, features and motifs

topic_3510.name: Protein sites, features and motifs

topic_3534.definition: Binding sites in proteins, including cleavage sites (for a proteolytic enzyme or agent), key residues involved in protein folding, catalytic residues (active site) of an enzyme, ligand-binding (non-catalytic) residues of a protein, such as sites that bind metal, prosthetic groups or lipids, RNA and DNA-binding proteins and binding sites etc.

path.name: Topic||Computational biology||Proteins||Protein sites, features and motifs||Protein binding sites
Topic||Computational biology||Sequence sites, features and motifs||Protein sites, features and motifs||Protein binding sites

topic_3534.name: Protein binding sites

topic_0080.definition: The archival, processing and analysis of molecular sequences (monomer composition of polymers) including molecular sequence data resources, sequence sites, alignments, motifs and profiles.
topic_0080.name: Sequence analysis

topic_0102.definition: The mapping of complete (typically nucleotide) sequences. Mapping (in the sense of short read alignment, or more generally, just alignment) has application in RNA-Seq analysis (mapping of transcriptomics reads), variant discovery (e.g. mapping of exome capture), and re-sequencing (mapping of WGS reads).
topic_0102.name: Mapping

topic_0157.definition: The archival, processing and analysis of the basic character composition of molecular sequences, for example character or word frequency, ambiguity, complexity, particularly regions of low complexity, and repeats or the repetitive nature of molecular sequences.

path.name: Topic||Computational biology||Sequence analysis||Sequence composition, complexity and repeats

topic_0157.name: Sequence composition, complexity and repeats

topic_0194.definition: The integrated study of evolutionary relationships and whole genome data, for example, in the analysis of species trees, horizontal gene transfer and evolutionary reconstruction.
topic_0194.name: Phylogenomics

topic_0196.definition: The assembly of fragments of a DNA sequence to reconstruct the original sequence.
topic_0196.name: Sequence assembly

topic_0632.definition: Molecular probes (e.g. a peptide probe or DNA microarray probe) or PCR primers and hybridisation oligos in a nucleic acid sequence.
topic_0632.name: Probes and primers

topic_0081.definition: The curation, processing, analysis and prediction of data about the structure of biological molecules, typically proteins and nucleic acids and other macromolecules.
topic_0081.name: Structure analysis

topic_0082.definition: The prediction of molecular structure, including the prediction, modelling, recognition or design of protein secondary or tertiary structure or other structural features, and the folding of nucleic acid molecules and the prediction or design of nucleic acid (typically RNA) sequences with specific conformations.
topic_0082.name: Structure prediction

topic_0176.definition: The study and simulation of molecular (typically protein) conformation using a computational model of physical forces and computer simulation.
topic_0176.name: Molecular dynamics

topic_2275.definition: The construction, analysis, evaluation, refinement etc. of models of a molecules properties or behaviour, including the modelling the structure of proteins in complex with small molecules or other macromolecules (docking).
topic_2275.name: Molecular modelling

topic_0154.definition: Small molecules of biological significance, typically archival, curation, processing and analysis of structural information.
topic_0154.name: Small molecules

topic_0160.definition: The archival, detection, prediction and analysis of positional features such as functional and other key sites, in molecular sequences and the conserved patterns (motifs, profiles etc.) that may be used to describe them.

path.name: Topic||Computational biology||Sequence sites, features and motifs

topic_0160.name: Sequence sites, features and motifs

children.name: Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs

topic_0602.definition: Molecular interactions, biological pathways, networks and other models.

path.name: Topic||Computational biology||Molecular interactions, pathways and networks

topic_0602.name: Molecular interactions, pathways and networks

topic_1775.definition: The study of gene and protein function including the prediction of functional properties of a protein.
topic_1775.name: Function analysis

topic_0085.definition: The study of gene or protein functions and their interactions in totality in a given organism, tissue, cell etc.
topic_0085.name: Functional genomics

topic_3892.definition: The study and simulation of molecular conformations using a computational model and computer simulations.
topic_3892.name: Biomolecular simulation

topic_3314.definition: The composition and properties of matter, reactions, and the use of reactions to create new substances.
topic_3314.name: Chemistry

topic_3332.definition: Topic concerning the development and application of theory, analytical methods, mathematical models and computational simulation of chemical systems.
topic_3332.name: Computational chemistry

topic_3336.definition: The discovery and design of drugs or potential drug compounds.

path.name: Topic||Biomedical science||Medicines research and development||Drug discovery

topic_3336.name: Drug discovery

topic_0209.definition: The design and chemical synthesis of bioactive molecules, for example drugs or potential drug compounds, for medicinal purposes.

path.name: Topic||Biomedical science||Medicines research and development||Drug discovery||Medicinal chemistry

topic_0209.name: Medicinal chemistry

topic_3343.definition: Collections of chemicals, typically for use in high-throughput screening experiments.

path.name: Topic||Biomedical science||Medicines research and development||Drug discovery||Compound libraries and screening

topic_3343.name: Compound libraries and screening

topic_3370.definition: The study of the separation, identification, and quantification of the chemical components of natural and artificial materials.
topic_3370.name: Analytical chemistry

topic_3371.definition: The use of chemistry to create new compounds.
topic_3371.name: Synthetic chemistry

topic_3315.definition: The study of numbers (quantity) and other topics including structure, space, and change.
topic_3315.name: Mathematics

topic_2269.definition: The application of statistical methods to biological problems.
topic_2269.name: Statistics and probability

topic_3569.definition: The application of mathematics to specific problems in science, typically by the formulation and analysis of mathematical models.
topic_3569.name: Applied mathematics

topic_3570.definition: The study of abstract mathematical concepts.
topic_3570.name: Pure mathematics

topic_3316.definition: The theory and practical use of computer systems.
topic_3316.name: Computer science

topic_0092.definition: Rendering (drawing on a computer screen) or visualisation of molecular sequences, structures or other biomolecular data.
topic_0092.name: Data visualisation

topic_3372.definition: The process that leads from an original formulation of a computing problem to executable programs.
topic_3372.name: Software engineering

topic_3473.definition: The discovery of patterns in large data sets and the extraction and trasnsformation of those patterns into a useful format.
topic_3473.name: Data mining

topic_3474.definition: A topic concerning the application of artificial intelligence methods to algorithms, in order to create methods that can learn from data in order to generate an ouput, rather than relying on explicitly encoded information only.
topic_3474.name: Machine learning

topic_3318.definition: The study of matter, space and time, and related concepts such as energy and force.
topic_3318.name: Physics

topic_3344.definition: Topic concerning biological science that is (typically) performed in the context of medicine.
topic_3344.name: Biomedical science

topic_0202.definition: The study of drugs and their effects or responses in living systems.
topic_0202.name: Pharmacology

topic_0208.definition: The influence of genotype on drug response, for example by correlating gene expression or single-nucleotide polymorphisms with drug efficacy or toxicity.
topic_0208.name: Pharmacogenomics

topic_0804.definition: The application of information technology to immunology such as immunological processes, immunological genes, proteins and peptide ligands, antigens and so on.
topic_0804.name: Immunology

topic_3067.definition: The form and function of the structures of living organisms.
topic_3067.name: Anatomy

topic_3337.definition: Repositories of biological samples, typically human, for basic biological and clinical research.
topic_3337.name: Biobank

topic_3338.definition: Laboratory study of mice, for example, phenotyping, and mutagenesis of mouse cell lines.
topic_3338.name: Mouse clinic

topic_3339.definition: Collections of microbial cells including bacteria, yeasts and moulds.
topic_3339.name: Microbial collection

topic_3340.definition: Collections of cells grown under laboratory conditions, specifically, cells from multi-cellular eukaryotes and especially animal cells.
topic_3340.name: Cell culture collection

topic_3341.definition: Collections of DNA, including both collections of cloned molecules, and populations of micro-organisms that store and propagate cloned DNA.
topic_3341.name: Clone library

topic_3304.definition: The study of the nervous system and brain; its anatomy, physiology and function.
topic_3304.name: Neurobiology

topic_3376.definition: The discovery, development and approval of medicines.
topic_3376.name: Medicines research and development

topic_3373.definition: The process of bringing a new drug to market once a lead compounds has been identified through drug discovery.

path.name: Topic||Biomedical science||Medicines research and development||Drug development

topic_3373.name: Drug development

topic_3374.definition: The process of formulating and administering a pharmaceutical compound to achieve a therapeutic effect.
topic_3374.name: Biotherapeutics

topic_3375.definition: The study of how a drug interacts with the body.

path.name: Topic||Biomedical science||Medicines research and development||Drug metabolism

topic_3375.name: Drug metabolism

topic_3377.definition: The safety (or lack) of drugs and other medical interventions.

path.name: Topic||Biomedical science||Medicines research and development||Safety sciences

topic_3377.name: Safety sciences

topic_3378.definition: The detection, assesment, understanding and prevention of adverse effects of medicines.

path.name: Topic||Biomedical science||Medicines research and development||Safety sciences||Pharmacovigilance

topic_3378.name: Pharmacovigilance

topic_3379.definition: The testing of new medicines, vaccines or procedures on animals (preclinical) and humans (clinical) prior to their approval by regulatory authorities.

path.name: Topic||Biomedical science||Medicines research and development||Preclinical and clinical studies
Topic||Experimental design and studies||Preclinical and clinical studies

topic_3379.name: Preclinical and clinical studies

topic_3393.definition: The processes that need to be in place to ensure the quality of products for human or animal use.

path.name: Topic||Biomedical science||Medicines research and development||Quality affairs

topic_3393.name: Quality affairs

topic_3394.definition: The protection of public health by controlling the safety and efficacy of products in areas including pharmaceuticals, veterinary medicine, medical devices, pesticides, agrochemicals, cosmetics, and complementary medicines.

path.name: Topic||Biomedical science||Medicines research and development||Regulatory affairs

topic_3394.name: Regulatory affairs

topic_3966.definition: The design of vaccines to protect against a particular pathogen, including antigens, delivery systems, and adjuvants to elicit a predictable immune response against specific epitopes.
topic_3966.name: Vaccinology

topic_3386.definition: The use of animals and alternatives in experimental research.
topic_3386.name: Laboratory animal science

topic_3679.definition: The design of an experiment involving non-human animals.
topic_3679.name: Animal study

topic_3390.definition: The study of the effects of food components on the metabolism, health, performance and disease resistance of humans and animals.  It also includes the study of human behaviours related to food choices.
topic_3390.name: Nutritional science

topic_3395.definition: Biomedical approaches to clinical interventions that involve the use of stem cells.
topic_3395.name: Regenerative medicine

topic_3361.definition: The procedures used to conduct an experiment.
topic_3361.name: Laboratory techniques

topic_3168.definition: The determination of complete (typically nucleotide) sequences, including those of genomes (full genome sequencing, de novo sequencing and resequencing), amplicons and transcriptomes.
topic_3168.name: Sequencing

topic_3169.definition: The analysis of protein-DNA interactions where chromatin immunoprecipitation (ChIP) is used in combination with massively parallel DNA sequencing to identify the binding sites of DNA-associated proteins.
topic_3169.name: ChIP-seq

topic_3170.definition: A topic concerning high-throughput sequencing of cDNA to measure the RNA content (transcriptome) of a sample, for example, to investigate how different alleles of a gene are expressed, detect post-transcriptional mutations or identify gene fusions.
topic_3170.name: RNA-Seq

topic_3673.definition: Laboratory technique to sequence the complete DNA sequence of an organism's genome at a single time.
topic_3673.name: Whole genome sequencing

topic_3676.definition: Laboratory technique to sequence all the protein-coding regions in a genome, i.e., the exome.
topic_3676.name: Exome sequencing

topic_3837.definition: Approach which samples, in parallel, all genes in all organisms present in a given sample, e.g. to provide insight into biodiversity and function.
topic_3837.name: Metagenomic sequencing

topic_3382.definition: The visual representation of an object.
topic_3382.name: Imaging

topic_3383.definition: The use of imaging techniques to understand biology.
topic_3383.name: Bioimaging

topic_3384.definition: The use of imaging techniques for clinical purposes for medical research.
topic_3384.name: Medical imaging

topic_3385.definition: The use of optical instruments to magnify the image of an object.
topic_3385.name: Light microscopy

topic_3444.definition: Techniques that uses magnetic fields and radiowaves to form images, typically to investigate the anatomy and physiology of the human body.
topic_3444.name: MRI

topic_3452.definition: Imaging in sections (sectioning), through the use of a wave-generating device (tomograph) that generates an image (a tomogram).
topic_3452.name: Tomography

topic_3954.definition: A diagnostic imaging technique based on the application of ultrasound.
topic_3954.name: Echography

topic_3516.definition: Genotype experiment including case control, population, and family studies. These might use array based methods and re-sequencing methods.
topic_3516.name: Genotyping experiment

topic_3518.definition: Microarray experiments including conditions, protocol, sample:data relationships etc.
topic_3518.name: Microarray experiment

topic_3519.definition: PCR experiments, e.g. quantitative real-time PCR.
topic_3519.name: PCR experiment

topic_3524.definition: Biological computational model experiments (simulation), for example the minimum information required in order to permit its correct interpretation and reproduction.
topic_3524.name: Simulation experiment

topic_3656.definition: Experimental techniques to purify a protein-DNA crosslinked complex.  Usually sequencing follows e.g. in the techniques ChIP-chip, ChIP-seq and MeDIP-seq.
topic_3656.name: Immunoprecipitation experiment

topic_3179.definition: Experimental techniques that combine chromatin immunoprecipitation ('ChIP') with microarray ('chip'). ChIP-on-chip is used for high-throughput study protein-DNA interactions.
topic_3179.name: ChIP-on-chip

topic_3674.definition: Laboratory technique to sequence the methylated regions in DNA.
topic_3674.name: Methylated DNA immunoprecipitation

topic_3794.definition: An antibody-based technique used to map in vivo RNA-protein interactions.
topic_3794.name: RNA immunoprecipitation

topic_3934.definition: Cytometry is the measurement of the characteristics of cells.
topic_3934.name: Cytometry

topic_3940.definition: Molecular biology methods used to analyze the spatial organization of chromatin in a cell.
topic_3940.name: Chromosome conformation capture

topic_3957.definition: An experiment for studying protein-protein interactions.
topic_3957.name: Protein interaction experiment

topic_3391.definition: The collective characterisation and quantification of pools of biological molecules that translate into the structure, function, and dynamics of an organism or organisms.
topic_3391.name: Omics

topic_0121.definition: Protein and peptide identification, especially in the study of whole proteomes of organisms.
topic_0121.name: Proteomics

topic_0622.definition: Whole genomes of one or more organisms, or genomes in general, such as meta-information on genomes, genome projects, gene names etc.
topic_0622.name: Genomics

topic_0797.definition: The study (typically comparison) of the sequence, structure or function of multiple genomes.
topic_0797.name: Comparative genomics

topic_3796.definition: Large-scale study (typically comparison) of DNA sequences of populations.
topic_3796.name: Population genomics

topic_3922.definition: A field of biological research focused on the discovery and identification of peptides, typically by comparing mass spectra against a protein database.
topic_3922.name: Proteogenomics

topic_3943.definition: The reconstruction and analysis of genomic information in extinct species.
topic_3943.name: Paleogenomics

topic_3172.definition: The systematic study of metabolites, the chemical processes they are involved, and the chemical fingerprints of specific cellular processes in a whole cell, tissue, organ or organism.
topic_3172.name: Metabolomics

topic_3955.definition: Experimental approaches to determine the rates of metabolic reactions - the metabolic fluxes - within a biological entity.
topic_3955.name: Fluxomics

topic_3967.definition: The study of immune system as a whole, its regulation and response to pathogens using genome-wide approaches.
topic_3967.name: Immunomics

topic_3678.definition: The design of an experiment intended to test a hypothesis, and describe or explain empirical data obtained under various experimental conditions.
topic_3678.name: Experimental design and studies
